questions.question_text:
You use the Java based Node Manager to start your managed servers. You want Node Manager to:
Stop servers by using your custom stop script : mystopit.sh
Restart servers when the hardware cases
Use SSL communication
Check server heath once per second
Below are portions of the node manager. properties file. Select the one that configures Node manager as described.
You are using the Embedded LDAP that is supplied by Oracle WebLogic Server. Which three statements are true? (Choose three.)

choices.C: The Embedded LDAP uses the file system to store WebLogic security provider data
choices.A: The Embedded LDAP can be accessed by an external LDAP viewer
choices.D: The Embedded LDAP uses the database to store WebLogic security provider data
choices.E: The Embedded LDAP can be used to store user, group, security roles and security policies for the WebLogic security providers
choices.B: The Embedded LDAP cannot be used in a production environment

discussion.content: i think that the correct answer is ACE

Selected Answer: ACE
I think it's ACE

questions.question_text: The development group supplied you with the latest WAR file for the company web application. It has been thoroughly tested and needs to be placed into production. In the production file system, you copy over the previous WAR file with the new version. You log into the administration console and redeploy the application. Current uses continue to access the older version of the application, while new users are taken to the new version. Explain this scenario.

discussion.content: Yes B is the correct answer

choices.C: This is not possible. When an application is redeployed, it replaces the old version and all users then access the new version
choices.A: This is only possible if the application is deployed to a cluster. Cluster deployments allow current users to continue to use the previous version of an application
choices.B: This is possible if the application is versioned by using the WebLogic Server feature called Production Redeployment.
choices.D: This is not possible. When an application is redeployed, all users continue to access the old version. Once all current users have exited the system, then all users from that point on access the new version

questions.question_text:
You successfully deployed an application on WebLogic 12c but notice that its deployment name is different than what you expected.
After checking various places and making multiple deployment attempts, you decide to be on the safe side and just use the method that takes precedence over the others when setting the deployment name. Which method should you use to override the default deployment name?

discussion.content:
C is correct:
The naming precedence is as follows, starting with the highest precedence:

The -name weblogic.Deployer option.

The name specified in the manifest file.

The name specified in the deployment descriptor.

A computed name based on the deployment source file.

choices.A: Define the name in the library's manifest file
choices.D: Set a computed name based on the deployment source file

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDE
I will answer C,D,E

choices.B: Add a new connection to the data source if none are available
choices.C: Close the connection to return the connection to the data source
choices.D: Request a connection from the data source
choices.A: Test the connection to verify the database's availability
choices.E: Look up the data source using the JNDI name

questions.question_text:
Consider a WebLogic Java EE application that uses a JDBC data source.
Which three steps would the application developer typically write code to perform? (Choose three.)
